page.title: 14Becca Hall
page.content: This impressive building, which is set in its own private grounds, is situated almost in the centre of the entire block (see page 11). Built in 1780 by William Markam it is now owned and used by the C.E.G.B. The family of John Fawcett bought it in 1907 and owned it until 1946. The C.E.G.B. bought it in 1958. Although an extension has been added to the original building, much of the original remains, both externally and internally. It has its own grounds in which wildlife, including pheasants and deer, abound. At present 98 people are employed at Becca Hall in various capacities, but most are engineers.
